plan: In the initial rounds, I will test conservative bids slightly above my value to gauge competitors' tendencies. Mid-game, I'll experiment with aggressive overbidding to gather data on their limits and potential bluffing. I'll also try underbidding slightly below my value to test if competitors are consistently aggressive. As patterns emerge, I will adapt by blending these strategies, focusing on maximizing profit by aligning my bids closely with the expected "price to win" based on observed behaviors. This iterative approach will help refine my strategy for optimal profit by the final rounds.

In the next rounds, I'll employ a mixed bidding strategy. For low values (below $33), I'll bid conservatively, slightly below my value, to minimize losses. For mid-range values ($34-$66), I'll bid closer to my value to balance risk and reward. For high values ($67-$99), I'll bid aggressively, slightly above my value, to maximize winning chances. I'll observe opponents' bidding patterns to adjust my strategy, particularly focusing on their responses to high-value bids. Periodically, I'll test aggressive bids on mid-range values to gather data on competitors' behaviors and refine my approach for maximizing long-term profit.

In the initial rounds, I'll test aggressive bidding by setting my bid slightly above my value to gather data on competitors' strategies. Mid-game, I'll shift to a conservative approach by bidding just below my value to maximize profit if competitors are aggressive. In later rounds, I'll adapt based on observed patterns, balancing between aggressive and conservative bids to optimize long-term profit. I'll also randomly incorporate a few low bids to detect any underbidding trends. This mix will help identify optimal strategies while minimizing losses.

Next, I'll bid slightly above my value for low values and aggressively for high values. I'll test underbidding slightly below my value to detect aggressive competitors. Mid-game, I'll overbid to explore limits. Adapt based on patterns, aiming to align bids with expected "price to win" for optimal profit.

For the next rounds, I'll test aggressive bids when my value is above $75, moderate bids for $50-$75, and conservative bids below $50. I'll analyze competitors' patterns, adjusting strategies accordingly. Periodically, I'll experiment with unexpected bids to gather insights on their reactions and refine my long-term strategy.
